techmeme.title: Sources including frontline health care workers say their testing of Google's AI-powered nurse handoff tool has left questions about its consistency and quality (Bloomberg)
Amazon is expanding its one- to two-day delivery capabilities to US rural areas, using hyper-efficient warehouses, contracted drivers, and mom-and-pop shops (Wall Street Journal)
The US SEC drops its securities claims about 10 tokens from its Binance lawsuit; its case against other Binance programs, like staking, looks set to proceed (Brady Dale/Axios)
Meta agrees to pay $1.4B to settle Texas' lawsuit accusing Meta of using facial recognition tech to collect biometric data of millions of Texans without consent (Reuters)
Microsoft calls on the US Congress to pass a comprehensive law to crack down on AI deepfakes that aim to interfere in elections or maliciously target people (Jeff Stone/Bloomberg)
